question: Why do we need a kernel?

terminology.definition: piece of software that is designed to act as an intermediate layer between low-level hardware (such as the processor, memory, and input/output devices) and high-level software, such as an operating system
terminology.source: Learn Linux Shell Scripting Fundamentals of Bash 4.4

answer: it handles a lot of low-level operations on many types of hardware

comment.what: the operating-system uses the abstraction provided by the kernel
comment.who: Learn Linux Shell Scripting Fundamentals of Bash 4.4

comment.what: operating-system developers can spend their time making an experience for their users, instead of worrying about how data is going to be written to storage
comment.who: Learn Linux Shell Scripting Fundamentals of Bash 4.4

subgroup.hint: Kernels are an essential component of modern computers
Explains the purpose of a kernel
